CatDescriptText: Mr. J.R. Krause, life insurance employee, Mr. Lebanon and Mrs. A. Crosby, housewife, Mt. Lebanon, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 30, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think the United States should go to war with Russia over Berlin?"  Mr. Krause's answer reads: "We should not go to war, however, I think that we are committed.  If they try to take away our rights to the airstrip, then we'll be on the spot.  Actually, I don't care who has Berlin but our prestige is at stake, therefore, we have to stick to our guns."  Mrs. Crosby's answer reads: "No, we shouldn't go to war, period.  There's the danger of nuclear was which will mean destruction of everyone."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of J.R. Krause wearing eyeglasses and dark paisley necktie, standing in front of automobiles and buildings; Portrait of Mrs. A. Crosby wearing eyeglasses and two strand beaded necklace, standing with arms crossed in front of store window
